text_management.tests.text_management.test_views module¶

class text_management.tests.text_management.test_views.TestViewsAjaxTextManagement(methodName='runTest')¶

Bases: django.test.testcases.TestCase

Class for testing the ajax functions. The first thing tested is always connecting to the view without being authenticated.

setUp()¶

Setting up the objects used during the tests

test_view_save_text_function_POST()¶

Testing the ajax function that saves a text. The function is reachable only through POST. Created custom test data. :returns: True if the response of the page is correct (302 if user not authenticated, 200 if authenticated)

test_view_translate_word_function_GET()¶

Testing the ajax function that saves a text. Created custom data for the tested translation. :return: True if the response of the page is correct (302 if user not authenticated, 200 if authenticated) :return: True if the translation of the data is correct (“come”, from english to italian, is “venire”)

class text_management.tests.text_management.test_views.TestViewsTextManagement(methodName='runTest')¶

Bases: django.test.testcases.TestCase

Test class to check correct functioning of Django views in Text Management app

It is first tested that the views are not reachable by a not authenticated user, then view functional check

setUp()¶
Set up of a sample test environment with a dummy client that impersonates the user and a sample text

to process during the test

test_view_text_analysis_deleting_short_words()¶

Checks if the words of an inserted text that are too short for the user are deleted and are not showed in the template.

class text_management.tests.text_management.tests.TestStatistics(methodName='runTest')¶

Bases: django.test.testcases.TestCase

setUp()¶

Set up of 3 sample text to use to check database functionality

test_avg_complexity()¶

Tests for the function of calculating the average complexity of a sets of Texts (model).

Returns

Passed if the return value of the function is the same as the average value calculated directly on the

database and locally with python sum(complexities)/len of the texts.

test_count_texts()¶

Tests for the function of calculating the number of a sets of Texts (model).

Returns

Number of texts
